cbb814c1c55338cd493d7b1829037b9e (02:06): is there a part to focus on when getting a mysql server (cpu, ram and disk), something that affects performance more than the rest?
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:07): and.... mysql network subscription!!!!!!
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:08): fzzzt: disk-i/o tends to be critical; lots of RAM helps.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:16): hello. i have trouble fetching primary key information with jdbc/connector-j from java.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:16): i can't fetch the names of the primary keys - i.e. the names of the column(s) that are primary keys in a given table.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:16): when i fetch the data, i get the name 'PRIMARY'.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:16): isn't it possible to look up the corresponding column name?
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:17): aje: Post the code to the pastebin.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:17): aje: There are several ways.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:17): aje: What version of MySQL are you using?
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:19): Did you write a testcase to test this behavior?
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:19): just a sec, pastebin is quite slow.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:19): Xgc: no, haven't had the time for testing it with mysql. i wrote the code for pgsql, but i thought it would be easy to port it to msql.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:20): aje: msql is not MySQL.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:20): sorry, i meant mysql. ;)
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:21): http://hashmysql.org/paste/viewentry.php?id=2161
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:21): i just pasted the method for retrieving the primary keys. it should be enogugh.
0420d605d97eb746182ce4101970b03a (02:22): metadata is an instance of DatabaseMetaData from jdbc.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:23): aje: There's also: SELECT * FROM information_schema.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE;
14d2aa0bd0b9473f3d2d941d7f365754 (02:36): is there any real difference between VARCHAR and TINYTEXT at all?
14d2aa0bd0b9473f3d2d941d7f365754 (02:38): hmm they both concern text, and they both can reach as far as 255 bytes... :/
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (02:39): varchar is sent to the storage engine inline with the rest of the row, tinytext is part of the blob array
09a56028a63f8e9351a49d2f8c51f8df (02:39): characters, not bytes.
09a56028a63f8e9351a49d2f8c51f8df (02:39): you can have a 700+ byte varchar field
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:40): Covah: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/blob.html
09a56028a63f8e9351a49d2f8c51f8df (02:40): they're treated very differently by most of the storage negines
304a9b489cfbad7416f8fa6e6b9ae9c3 (02:42): aha, I have finally broken Google's speed on unique searches (although I don't have as near a big of database to search)
304a9b489cfbad7416f8fa6e6b9ae9c3 (02:42): only about 31,024 records
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (02:45): Timtow, see http://jayant7k.blogspot.com/2006/06/benchmarking-results-of-mysql-lucene.html

c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (02:46): Hey guys, I've got a small issue with mysql 4.0.  I'm using SQL yog to back up all my tables so I can reinstall the server (inno-db tables) but one of the tables is so big that when I start a query on it mysql hangs and restarts itself.  Is that data just lost, or is there another way to recover it?
304a9b489cfbad7416f8fa6e6b9ae9c3 (02:47): I don't think this is a bad score, do you archivist? Showing results 1 to 10 of 942 for "jesus" (0.13 seconds)
304a9b489cfbad7416f8fa6e6b9ae9c3 (02:47): and it only took me two days
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:49): joseph: stop the server and back up the data files (*all* of them)
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:49): joseph: it's a hack, but it should work
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:49): but first, try if mysqldump does the job - after all, it's the tool that was designed for it.
c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (02:49): I thought that didn't work with inno db tables?
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:50): innodb stuffs everything into one huge file
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:50): if you want a backup of *everything*, then it works
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:50): if you want individual databses, then it doesn't
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:50): joseph: but anyway - i'm not a wiz, so... read some docs
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:51): i don't want you to come and kill me when things go awry :P
c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (02:51): lol, no worries.  Thanks for your help :)
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (02:52): there is a backup guide in the manual
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:52): joseph: remember that innodb data is not in the by-database directories; and, as i said, look at mysqldump first
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:52): and yes, there's a manual :=
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:53): .oO(hm, let'S try this...)
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:53): !tell us about backup
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (02:53): But I don't know a thing about that.
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (02:53): (Database Backups) : http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/Backup.html
9c2d844978f7507ce5d1a5b9c31a1a01 (02:53): !man mysqldump
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (02:53): (The mysqldump Database Backup Program) : http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/mysqldump.html

434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:02): Let's go with a no.
c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (03:02): vb.net is easier, c# is better
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:02): Maybe that's what I meant.
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:02): What is better for you might not be for me.
c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (03:02): faster, more reliable, more support, more "C like" syntax
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:02): Faster processing or faster to program?
c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (03:03): my openion anyway
c93f77eb011a52ffbc89690e1f958ca7 (03:03): vb.net is faster to make programs, but I'm pretty sure c# makes things more efficiant
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:03): The ability to write a program in 5 minutes is worth tenfold more than having the program run .5 seconds faster.
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:03): Then vb.net it is! :)
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:04): I need to spend as little time programming as possible. I have other things to do.
434898b7c6bf8efde0d23c3290616991 (03:04): I should learn AppleScript.
